IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Old North Road.

Steps.Message: Hi, this is a message from Will at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut that is currently in progress today. Good news our customer support vehicle has now arrived in your area. The agent will be knocking on the doors of the known vulnerable customers needing support in the area first, before parking up to offer support, so if you would like them to come and see you, please call us free on 105 to make us aware. Once they have done this, they will remain at their vehicle where they can provide free hot drinks, charging points, Wi-Fi and face-to-face support. If you have any further questions or concerns, do not hesitate to call us free on 105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: These works were originally due to take place on the 16th September but had to be cancelled due to some customers needing to go off who had not been notified. To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 3 cable and 6 poles that need upgrading. We will also be installing 4 new electricity poles. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place in Louis Drive and Louis Drive West.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A customer has asked UK Power Networks to switch off the power so they can safely cut back trees in the area that have grown close to overhead electricity cables. These trees could cause damage to the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so a tree surgeon can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place on Spains Hall Road.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 06:31 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers diverted power around the  network fault in the St. Anns Hill Road area and also connect up temporary generators, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. 

There are now only four properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know your power may have been off for a long time, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 05:32 - Some of our engineers are coming to the end of their shift and are being replaced, so don't be alarmed if you see some of our vans leave the area, work will continue until full repairs have been completed.

If you would like any further information, or if you have a vulnerable person at home, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us we need to get another generator to site as well as carrying out additional repairs. 

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 11:00 and 12:00 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Lisa at 04:32.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 19:12 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that the excavations to the second fault on the network are taking longer than expected. Due to the delay this has caused, they've advised a new time of 22:30-23:30 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 18:15 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the St. Albans Road area, the estimated time of 20:00-21:00 hasn't changed. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Our team are always here if you have any questions.

Sent by Lisa at 04:06 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Thorpe Esplanade area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers have located, excavated and repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for bearing with us over tonight.

Our specialist cable jointers have so far been unable to pinpoint the underground cabling fault, so they have instructed our digging gang to excavate our cabling. This will allow them to cut our cable, and using specialist equipment, test each side to help narrow down where the fault lies.

Our estimated time frame doesn't need to change currently, and we'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here on 08003163105 from any phone if you have any questions. Sent by Lisa at 03:00.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 23:30 - We can now confirm that all power in the Barnfield area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Barnfield area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Lisa at 22:18.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, Lisa here - I just wanted to introduce myself, and let you know that I'll be here through the night to keep you updated with news from our staff as they work to get your lights back on.

In order to provide you the clearest information, my team and I write our updates in real time. Because of this, I apologise in advance if I make any mistakes with spelling or grammar; we're only human!

I know that it's dark and that will be especially worrying, but both our field teams and our contact centre work 24 hours a day, so for now, I hope you're doing okay and I'll let you know as soon as we have some more news.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 00:10 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Merrilees Road area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again today. We believed all power was restored but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue which is causing our substation equipment to operate repeatedly.

Our engineers are still on site and we are now aiming to have all power back on between 02:00 and 03:00. We'll keep you updated with all of our progress.. Sent by Lisa at 23:43.

Steps.Message: Sent by Will at 10:06 - Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 164 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 315 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. To help restore the final supplies we are sending a temporary generator to be connected. We'll let you know when this arrives. At this stage we don't need to change the estimated time frame and I'll continue to keep you updated. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 08:14 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that they have found some damaged overhead network equipment that will need to be repaired. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 13:00 and 14:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 05:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Will at 10:06 - Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 164 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 315 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised.

To help restore the final supplies we are sending a temporary generator to be connected. We'll let you know when this arrives. At this stage we don't need to change the estimated time frame and I'll continue to keep you updated.

If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue until everyone is back on.

To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

Sent by Will at 08:14 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that they have found some damaged overhead network equipment that will need to be repaired. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 13:00 and 14:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the Tonbridge Road area, the estimated time of11:00 and 12:00 hasn't changed.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can.

We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 07:30. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Winter is here and temperatures are low, so we understand that it can be very concerning to have a power cut as this may have affected your heating.

Should you have a gas hob, you may be able to carefully ignite it with matches or a lighter in order for you to warm up with a hot drink or meal. Please only attempt this if you are confident it can be done safely.

If you have someone in the property who may be more vulnerable to the cold please do not hesitate to call us free on 105.

We will do our best to provide additional care and support whilst work continues to get your power back on ASAP.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Valkyrie Road, SS0 8 area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 1230 - 1330 this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If this happens we'll need to arrange further teams and equipment, so I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us. Sent by Lee at 09:20.

We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  We are arranging to have engineers investigate the fault.  We are sorry we can't give you a time for the restoration of supply at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 13:55. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on
